titles.title: Indo-Pacific Cooperation Act of 2019
Indo-Pacific Cooperation Act of 2019
Indo-Pacific Cooperation Act of 2019
Indo-Pacific Cooperation Act of 2019
Indo-Pacific Cooperation Act of 2019
A bill to state the policy of the United States with respect to the expansion of cooperation with allies and partners in the Indo-Pacific region and Europe regarding the People's Republic of China.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.
Committee on Foreign Relations. Ordered to be reported with an amendment favorably.
Committee on Foreign Relations. Reported by Senator Risch with an amendment in the nature of a substitute. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 363.

action.text: Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
The committee substitute as amended agreed to by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

bill.summary:
Indo-Pacific Cooperation Act of 2019
This bill states that it is U.S. policy to (1) expand alliances and partnerships in the Indo-Pacific region and Europe to develop a unified approach to addressing the diplomatic, economic, and military challenges posed by China; and (2) promote democracy and human rights in partnership with like-minded countries.
